input_data.title: See
input_data.overview: A virus has decimated humankind. Those who survived emerged blind. Centuries later when twins are born with the mythic ability to see, their father must protect his tribe against a threatened queen.

response.analytical_summary: See is a dystopian drama series set in a post-apocalyptic world where humanity has lost its sight. The narrative centers on a father's desperate attempt to safeguard his twin children, who possess the extraordinary ability to see, from a ruthless queen who views them as a threat to her power. The series blends elements of sci-fi, fantasy, and action, exploring themes of family, survival, and the struggle for freedom in a world defined by blindness and fear. It offers a visually striking and emotionally charged experience, emphasizing the importance of hope and connection in the face of adversity.
response.spoiler_rich_plot_summary: The series begins with Jerlamarel, a man who has lived his entire life in a tribe of blind people, discovering that his newborn twins, Kofun and Tamactiuk, can see. This revelation throws the tribe into turmoil, as their ability to see is considered a dangerous anomaly, threatening the established order and the queen's control. Jerlamarel, along with his wife Maghra, must protect the twins from the queen’s forces, who view them as a potential challenge to her reign. As the twins grow, they learn to navigate the world and harness their unique abilities, while also grappling with the responsibility that comes with their sight. The twins are separated and face different trials, encountering new tribes and learning about the history of the world before the blindness. Jerlamarel and Maghra embark on perilous journeys to reunite with their children and fight for their freedom. The series explores the complex dynamics of power, the importance of family, and the enduring human spirit in a world stripped of its most fundamental sense.
response.keyword_sentence: Set in a grim, post-apocalyptic world, See explores themes of family loyalty and survival as a father protects his children who possess the extraordinary ability to see, navigating tribal conflicts and a ruthless queen’s power struggle.
